COHORT.EMPTY: You have not defined a cohort yet. Upload an existing Cohort Selection or create a new one.
COHORT.REQUIRED: Cohort selection is a mandatory field

DATASELECTION.EMPTY: You have not defined a feature selection yet. Upload an existing feature selection or create a new one.

ERROR.DOWNLOAD: No cohort defined, download not possible
ERROR.UPLOAD: No valid cohort was defined in the uploaded file

EDITOR.HEADER_DESCRIPTION: Here you can define which features of patients in the cohort are relevant to your research question. Pay attention to data sparseness and congruence with the description in the study protocol / ethics vote / research proposal (if already available). Change the selection by clicking on the pencil icon and add further filters (e.g. for specific diagnosis codes) if required

SEARCH.HEADER_INFO: For your research question, you can now define which data you would like to receive from the patients in the cohort. The available data is standardized throughout Germany using core data set (CDS) modules. You can also filter data points, e.g. if only certain laboratory values are of interest, and you have the option of specifying which data points are absolutely necessary for your research question.
SEARCH.INFOTEXT: Please select the criteria you would like to study and download your data definition. You can upload the data selection file as an attachment to your research proposal in the proposal portal.

ERROR.FEAS-10001: Your account has been locked due to too many queries, please contact info@research-for-health.de
ERROR.FEAS-10002: You have made too many queries, please wait and try again
ERROR.FEAS-10003: You have made too many queries, please wait and try again
ERROR.FEAS-10004: The result set is too small -> result will not be displayed
ERROR.FEAS-10005: The number of locations that responded is too small -> detailed result will not be displayed
ERROR.FEAS-10006: You have saved too many cohorts, please delete cohort selections before saving more
ERROR.VAL-20001: The combination of context and term code(s) was not found

CONSENT.EU_GDPR: All data recipients in countries with data protection levels compliant with EU GDPR
CONSENT.NON_EU_GDPR: Data recipients abroad with data protection levels lower than EU GDPR
CONSENT.TITLE: Required consents for data processing
CONSENT.no-no-no-no: Central, non-EU GDPR compliant analysis, without health insurance data, and without recontacting

CONSENT.no-no-yes-no: Central, non-EU GDPR compliant analysis, with health insurance data, and without recontacting

CONSENT.yes-no-no-no: Distributed, non-EU GDPR compliant analysis, without health insurance data, and without recontacting

CONSENT.yes-no-yes-no: Distributed, non-EU GDPR compliant analysis, with health insurance data, and without recontacting

EDITOR.EMPTY: Sorry, we could not find any results for
EDITOR.HEADER_INFO: Edit your criteria here and compile your cohort selection. The cohort selection can be used to directly submit a cross-location feasibility query.

HINT.MAXIMUM_EXCEEDED: Value must be at most {{ max }}
HINT.MINIMUM_EXCEEDED: Value must be at least {{ min }}
HINT.MINIMUM_GREATER_MAXIMUM: The minimum value must be less than the maximum value
HINT.NO_CRITERIA_SELECTED: At least one inclusion criterion must be selected
HINT.SEARCH_TEXT_NO_INPUT: Enter a search criterion or open the category overview

RESULT.DETAILS_TOOLTIP: The number shows you how many of your detailed result calls you have used - reset daily
RESULT.HEADER_DESCRIPTION: The number of patients who meet the criteria of your cohort is determined across locations. This result is not exact.
RESULT.MESSAGE429: You have reached the maximum number of calls for location breakdown.
RESULT.PATIENT_NUMBER_TOOLTIP: Feasibility queries return approximate results. The query results are anonymized and deliberate deviations from the exact result are introduced. Therefore, the results are only suitable for the initial assessment of the feasibility of your project. They should not be used for scientific work. Publishing the numbers is generally not permitted. The actual number of patients available can only be determined when your project is requested via a data usage application and reviewed by the responsible Use & Access Committees.

SAVE_DIALOG.HEADER_DESCRIPTION: The number of patients who meet the criteria of your cohort is determined across locations. This result is not exact.

SEARCH.EMPTY: Sorry, we could not find any results for
SEARCH.HEADER_INFO: Define your cohort based on criteria that you can select via the search field. For targeted searches, you can restrict to specific terminologies (e.g. ICD10, LOINC, OPS) or CDS modules. You can use the cohort selection directly to estimate the number of patients nationwide.
SEARCH.LABEL: Enter code or search term
SEARCH.SEARCHBAR: Search for term or terminology code

ADDED_CRITERIA.PLURAL: You have added {{amount}} criteria to the cohort selection
ADDED_CRITERIA.SINGULAR: You have added {{amount}} criterion to the cohort selection

DELETE_MODAL.TITLE: Do you really want to delete the data query?

TIMERESTRICTION.LABEL: Time period
TIMERESTRICTION.TITLE: Time period (optional)
TIMERESTRICTION.WARNING: The start date must be earlier than the end date
